poem:
Innocence Betrayed

In corridors where life begins,  
her hands betrayed the fragile breath—  
silent custodian of grievous sins,  
a shadow among the cribs of death.  

Vigilant whispers, too late to shield,  
where trust was softest, love unrepaid,  
a cold cruelty unwillingly revealed—  
innocence in swaddling clothes,  
betrayed.
